access-log-fields.title: Access Log Fields
access-log-fields.description: Displays HTTP request logs from the Pomerium Proxy service.

authorize-log-fields.title: Authorize Log Fields
authorize-log-fields.description: Displays HTTP request logs from the Pomerium Authorize service.

address.title: Address
address.description: Specifies the Host and Port to serve HTTP requests from.

authenticate-service-url.title: Authenticate Service URL
authenticate-service-url.description: The externally accessible URL for the authenticate service.

autocert.title: Autocert
autocert.description: Turning on autocert allows Pomerium to automatically retrieve, manage, and renew public facing TLS certificates from Lets Encrypt.

autocert-ca.title: Autocert CA
autocert-ca.description: Autocert CA is the directory URL of the ACME CA to use when requesting certificates.

autocert-email.title: Autocert Email
autocert-email.description: Autocert Email is the email address to use when requesting certificates from an ACME CA.

autocert-directory.title: Autocert Directory
autocert-directory.description: Autocert directory is the path which Autocert will store x509 certificate data.

autocert-use-staging.title: Autocert Use Staging
autocert-use-staging.description: Autocert Use Staging setting allows you to use Let's Encrypt's staging environment, which has more lenient usage limits than the production environment.

autocert-eab-key-id.title: Autocert EAB Key ID
autocert-eab-key-id.description: Autocert EAB Key ID is the key identifier when requesting a certificate from a CA with External Account Binding enabled.

autocert-eab-mac-key.title: Autocert EAB MAC Key
autocert-eab-mac-key.description: Autocert EAB MAC Key is the base64, url-encoded secret key corresponding to the Autocert EAB Key ID.

downstream-mtls-client-certificate-autho.title: Downstream mTLS Certificate Authority
downstream-mtls-client-certificate-autho.description: A bundle of PEM-encoded X.509 certificates that will be treated as trust anchors when verifying client certificates

downstream-mtls-crl.title: Downstream mTLS Certificate Revocation List
downstream-mtls-crl.description: A bundle of PEM-encoded certificate revocation lists to be consulted during certificate validation.

downstream-mtls-enforcement.title: Downstream mTLS Enforcement Mode
downstream-mtls-enforcement.description: Controls Pomerium's behavior when a client does not present a trusted client certificate.

downstream-mtls-match-subject-alt-names.title: Downstream mTLS Match SANs
downstream-mtls-match-subject-alt-names.description: Require that each certificate contain a certain type of SAN.

downstream-mtls-max-verify-depth.title: Downstream mTLS Max Verify Depth
downstream-mtls-max-verify-depth.description: Sets a limit on the depth of a certificate chain presented by the client.

identity-provider-settings.title: Identity Provider Settings
identity-provider-settings.description: Configure and self-host your own Identity Provider with Pomerium's Identity Provider settings.

downstream-mtls-settings.title: Downstream mTLS Settings
downstream-mtls-settings.description: Manage client certificate requirements for end users connecting to Pomerium-managed routes with downstream mTLS settings.

identity-provider.title: Identity Provider
identity-provider.description: Choose from a list of supported IDPs.

idp-options-google.title: Identity Provider Google
idp-options-google.description: Click for information on getting a service account from Google.

polling-min-delay.title: Min Polling Delay
polling-min-delay.description: Minimum delay between requests to the IdP Directory.

polling-max-delay.title: Max Polling Delay
polling-max-delay.description: Maximum delay between requests to the IdP Directory.

javascript-security.title: Javascript Security
javascript-security.description: If applied, prevents JavaScript in browsers from reading user session cookies.

expires.title: Expiration
expires.description: Sets the lifetime of session cookies. After this interval, users must reauthenticate.

ext-data-record-type.title: External Data Record Type
ext-data-record-type.description: Overridden by the directory structure of an archive file dataset

ext-data-foreign-key.title: Foreign Key
ext-data-foreign-key.description: Associates this key from a request to the external data

ext-data-headers.title: External Data Request Headers
ext-data-headers.description: Used when requesting the external dataset

global-timeouts.title: Global Timeouts
global-timeouts.description: Timeouts set the global server timeouts. Timeouts can also be set for individual routes.

read-timeout.title: Read Timeout
read-timeout.description: Sets the amount of time for the client to receive the entire request stream.

write-timeout.title: Write Timeout
write-timeout.description: Sets max stream duration of an HTTP request/response exchange. Must be greater than read timeout.

idle-timeout.title: Idle Timeout
idle-timeout.description: Sets the time at which a downstream or upstream connection will be terminated if no active streams.

grpc-settings.title: gRPC Settings
grpc-settings.description: Configure gRPC configuration settings in Pomerium.

grpc-address.title: gRPC Address
grpc-address.description: Address specifies the host and port to serve GRPC requests from.

grpc-insecure.title: gRPC Insecure
grpc-insecure.description: If set, GRPC Insecure disables transport security for communication between the proxy and authorize components.

http-redirect-address.title: HTTP Redirect Address
http-redirect-address.description: If set, HTTP Redirect Address specifies the Host and Port to redirect HTTP to HTTPS traffic on.

insecure-server.title: Insecure Server
insecure-server.description: Turning on insecure server mode will result in pomerium starting, and operating without any protocol encryption in transit.

dns-lookup-family.title: DNS Lookup Family
dns-lookup-family.description: Sets the DNS IP address resolution policy.

log-level.title: Log Level
log-level.description: Sets the global logging level for this cluster.

metrics-address.title: Metrics Address
metrics-address.description: Expose a prometheus format HTTP endpoint on the specified port.

metrics-client-certificate-authority.title: Metrics Client Certificate Authority
metrics-client-certificate-authority.description: Client certificate authority relative file location string

proxy-log-level.title: Proxy Log Level
proxy-log-level.description: Sets the logging level for the Pomerium Proxy service.

service-mode.title: Service Mode
service-mode.description: Service mode sets the pomerium service(s) to run.

shared-secret.title: Shared Secret
shared-secret.description: Shared Secret is the base64-encoded, 256-bit key used to mutually authenticate requests between services.

shared-secret-file.title: Shared Secret File
shared-secret-file.description: File path containing base64-encoded shared secret.

tracing-provider.title: Tracing Provider
tracing-provider.description: The name of the tracing provider. For example, Jaeger or Zipkin. Required.

tracing-sample-rate.title: Tracing Sample Rate
tracing-sample-rate.description: The percentage of requests to sample in decimal notation. Default is 0.0001, or .01%. Optional.

authenticate-callback-path.title: Authenticate Callback Path
authenticate-callback-path.description: The authenticate callback path is the path/url from the authenticate service that will receive the response from your identity provider.

identity-provider-client-id.title: Identity Provider Client ID
identity-provider-client-id.description: The OAuth 2.0 Client Identifier retrieved from an identity provider.

identity-provider-client-secret-file.title: Identity Provider Client Secret File
identity-provider-client-secret-file.description: File path containing the client secret, the OAuth 2.0 Secret Identifier retrieved from your identity provider.

identity-provider-client-secret.title: Identity Provider Client Secret
identity-provider-client-secret.description: The OAuth 2.0 Secret Identifier retrieved from an identity provider.

identity-provider-name.title: Identity Provider Name
identity-provider-name.description: The short-hand name of an OIDC identity provider used for authentication.

identity-provider-scopes.title: Identity Provider Scopes
identity-provider-scopes.description: IdP scopes correspond to access privilege scopes. For example, 'openid', 'profile', 'email', or 'offline_access'.

identity-provider-url.title: Identity Provider URL
identity-provider-url.description: The base URL to an identity provider's OIDC discovery document.

request-parameters.title: Identity Provider Request Params
request-parameters.description: Specifies a mapping of HTTP headers to be added to proxied requests. Downstream application headers will be overwritten by Pomerium's headers on conflict.
request-parameters.type: map of strings key value pairs

identity-provider-polling-min-max-delay.title: Identity Provider Min/Max Delay
identity-provider-polling-min-max-delay.description: Sets the minimum and maximum delay times between requests to the identity provider directory.

authorize-service-url.title: Authorize Service URL
authorize-service-url.description: Authorize Service URL is the location of the internally accessible Authorize service.

default-upstream-timeout.title: Default Upstream Timeout
default-upstream-timeout.description: Sets the default timeout applied to a proxied route when no timeout key is specified by the policy.

response-headers.title: Set Response Headers
response-headers.description: Sets static HTTP Response Header values for all managed routes.
response-headers.type: map of strings key value pairs

set-response-headers-route.title: Set Response Headers (Per Route)
set-response-headers-route.description: Sets static response header values for a route. These headers take precedence over globally set response headers.
set-response-headers-route.type: map of strings key value pairs

jwt-claim-headers.title: JWT Claim Headers
jwt-claim-headers.description: Passes user session data to upstream applications as HTTP Request Headers and additional JWT claims.

override-certificate-name.title: Override Certificate Name
override-certificate-name.description: Secure service communication can fail if the external certificate does not match the internally routed service hostname/SNI.

x-forwarded-for-http-header.title: Skip XFF Append
x-forwarded-for-http-header.description: Do not append client IP address to X-Forwarded-For header.

the-number-of-trusted-hops.title: XFF Number of Trusted Hops
the-number-of-trusted-hops.description: The number of trusted reverse proxies in front of pomerium.

data-broker-storage-connection-string.title: Databroker Storage Connection String
data-broker-storage-connection-string.description: Sets the database connection string to connect Databroker service to storage backend.

allow-any-authenticated-user.title: Allow Any Authenticated User
allow-any-authenticated-user.description: Allows all requests for any authenticated user or service account. Use with caution.

error-message-header.title: Error Message Header
error-message-header.description: A paragraph that will appear on all Route Error Pages in the top section.

favicon-url.title: Favicon Url
favicon-url.description: A Url pointing to your favicon. Defaults to Pomerium's Favicon.

from.title: From
from.description: The external URL for a proxied request. Must contain a scheme and Hostname, must not contain a path.

health-checks.title: Health Checks
health-checks.description: Issues periodic health check requests to upstream servers. Unhealthy servers won't serve traffic.

health-checks-timeout.title: Health Checks Timeout
health-checks-timeout.description: The total time to wait for a health check response. Required.

health-checks-interval.title: Health Checks Interval
health-checks-interval.description: The interval between health checks. Required.

health-checks-unhealthy-threshold.title: Health Checks Unhealthy Threshold
health-checks-unhealthy-threshold.description: The number of unhealthy health checks required before a host is marked unhealthy. Required.

health-checks-healthy-threshold.title: Health Checks Healthy Threshold
health-checks-healthy-threshold.description: The number of healthy health checks required before a host is marked healthy. Required.

http-health-check-host.title: HTTP Health Check Host
http-health-check-host.description: The Host header value in the HTTP health check request. If empty, the name of the cluster this health check is associated with will be used. Optional.

http-health-check-path.title: HTTP Health Check Path
http-health-check-path.description: Specifies the HTTP path requested during a health check. Required.

http-health-check-expected-statuses.title: HTTP Health Check Expected Statuses
http-health-check-expected-statuses.description: Defines a range of HTTP response statuses that are considered healthy. Optional.

http-health-check-codec-client-type.title: HTTP Health Check Codec Client Type
http-health-check-codec-client-type.description: Specifies which application protocol to use. Optional.

tcp-health-check-send.title: TCP Health Check Send
tcp-health-check-send.description: Defines the payload, which must be one of text or binary. An empty payload results in a connect-only health check. Optional.

tcp-health-check-receive.title: TCP Health Check Receive
tcp-health-check-receive.description: Checks a response with 'fuzzy' matching to the extent that each payload block must be found, and in the specified order, but not necessarily contiguous. Optional.

grpc-health-check-authority.title: gRPC Health Check Authority
grpc-health-check-authority.description: Specifies the ':authority' header value in a gRPC health check request. Optional.

grpc-health-check-service-name.title: gRPC Health Check Service Name
grpc-health-check-service-name.description: Specifies the service name parameter sent to the gRPC service. Optional.

host-rewrite.title: Host Rewrite
host-rewrite.description: Rewrites the Host header to a new literal value.

host-rewrite-header.title: Host Rewrite Header
host-rewrite-header.description: Rewrites the Host header to match an incoming header value.

host-path-rewrite-header.title: Host Path Rewrite Header
host-path-rewrite-header.description: Rewrites the Host header according to a regular expression matching the path.

host-path-rewrite-substitution.title: Host Path Regex Rewrite Substitution
host-path-rewrite-substitution.description: Rewrites the Host header according to a regular expression matching the substitution.

route-idle-timeout.title: Idle Timeout
route-idle-timeout.description: Sets the time to terminate the upstream connection if there are no active streams. Defaults to 5 minutes.

kubernetes-service-account-token.title: Kubernetes Service Account Token
kubernetes-service-account-token.description: String containing a Kubernetes bearer token.

kubernetes-service-account-token-file.title: Kubernetes Service Account Token File
kubernetes-service-account-token-file.description: File location containing a Kubernetes bearer token.

service-account-token.title: Service Account Token
service-account-token.description: The generated JWT used to authenticate this service account. See documentation for supported authentication methods and examples.

service-account-description.title: Service Account Description
service-account-description.description: A customizable description that identifies this service account.

service-account-expiration.title: Service Account Expiration
service-account-expiration.description: Sets the expiration time for this service account token. After the specified date, this token becomes invalid.

service-account-user-id.title: Service Account User ID
service-account-user-id.description: The User ID associated with this service account.

load-balancing-policy.title: Load Balancing Policy
load-balancing-policy.description: Defines the Load Balancing strategy for multiple upstream servers.

logo-url.title: Logo Url
logo-url.description: A Url pointing to your logo. Defaults to Pomerium's Logo.

pass-identity-headers-per-route.title: Pass Identity Headers (per route)
pass-identity-headers-per-route.description: If applied, passes X-Pomerium-Jwt-Assertion header and JWT Claims Headers to the upstream application.

pass-identity-headers.title: Pass Identity Headers
pass-identity-headers.description: If applied, passes X-Pomerium-Jwt-Assertion header and JWT Claims Headers to all upstream applications.

path-matching-settings.title: Path Matching Settings
path-matching-settings.description: Configure Path Matching settings in Pomerium.

path.title: Path
path.description: Matches incoming requests with a path that is an exact match for the specified path.

policy-enforcement.title: Policy Enforcement
policy-enforcement.description: Determines if a policy applies to all routes or can be applied optionally to a given route.

policy-description.title: Policy Description
policy-description.description: Adds an optional description for this policy.

policy-definition.title: Definition
policy-definition.description: Adds the explanation presented to an unauthorized user when they access a route with this policy. Optional.

policy-explanation.title: Explanation
policy-explanation.description: Adds the explanation presented to an unauthorized user when they access a route with this policy. Optional.

policy-remediation.description: Adds the message, warning, or instructions presented to an unauthorized user to help them self-remediate. Optional.
policy-remediation.title: Remediation

prefix.title: Prefix
prefix.description: Matches incoming requests with a path that begins with the specified prefix.

path-rewriting-settings.title: Path Rewriting Settings
path-rewriting-settings.description: Configure Path Rewriting settings in Pomerium.

prefix-rewrite.title: Prefix Rewrite
prefix-rewrite.description: While forwarding a request, Prefix Rewrite swaps the matched prefix (or path) with the specified value.

preserve-host-header.title: Preserve Host Header
preserve-host-header.description: Passes the host header from the incoming request to the proxied host, instead of the destination hostname.

primary-color.title: Primary Color
primary-color.description: A hex code that determines the primary color for the Enterprise Console and Route Error Details pages.

primary-color-dark-mode.title: Primary Color (Dark Mode)
primary-color-dark-mode.description: A hex code that determines the primary color for the Enterprise Console and Route Error Details pages when in Dark Mode.

public-access.title: Public Access
public-access.description: Instructs Pomerium to grant unauthorized and unauthenticated access to all requests to the upstream service. Should be applied only to public web services. If applied, no other policy should be provided for this route.

redirect.title: Redirect
redirect.description: Redirects incoming requests to a new URL.

scheme-redirect.title: Scheme Redirect
scheme-redirect.description: Swaps the incoming Scheme with the specified value.

host-redirect.title: Host Redirect
host-redirect.description: Swaps the incoming Host with the specified value.

port-redirect.title: Port Redirect
port-redirect.description: Swaps the incoming Port with the specified value. Type: Integer.

path-redirect.title: Path Redirect
path-redirect.description: Swaps the incoming Path portion of the URL with the specified value.

prefix-rewrite-redirect.title: Prefix Rewrite Redirect
prefix-rewrite-redirect.description: Swaps the incoming Matched Prefix with the specified value.

response-code.title: Response Code
response-code.description: Sets the Response Code to use for the redirect. Defaults to 301. Type: Integer.

strip-query.title: Strip Query
strip-query.description: Indicates that during redirection, the Query portion of the URL will be removed. Defaults to false.

regex.title: Regex
regex.description: Matches incoming requests with a path that matches the specified regular expression.

regex-priority-order.title: Regex Priority Order
regex-priority-order.description: Rewrites the URL path according to the regex rewrite pattern.

regex-rewrite.title: Regex Rewrite
regex-rewrite.description: Rewrites the URL path according to the regex rewrite pattern.

regex-rewrite-substitution.title: Regex Rewrite Substitution
regex-rewrite-substitution.description: Rewrites the URL path according to the regex rewrite substitution.

remove-request-headers.title: Remove Request Headers
remove-request-headers.description: Removes given request headers so they do not reach the upstream server.

rewrite-response-headers.title: Rewrite Response Headers
rewrite-response-headers.description: Modifies response headers before they are returned to the client. 'Header' matches the HTTP header name; 'prefix' will be replaced with 'value'.

route-timeout.title: Route Timeout
route-timeout.description: Sets the per-route timeout value. Cannot exceed global timeout values. Defaults to 30 seconds.

secondary-color.title: Secondary Color
secondary-color.description: A hex code that determines the secondary color for the Enterprise Console and Route Error Details pages.

secondary-color-dark-mode.title: Secondary Color (Dark Mode)
secondary-color-dark-mode.description: A hex code that determines the secondary color for the Enterprise Console and Route Error Details pages when in Dark Mode.

set-request-headers.title: Set Request Headers
set-request-headers.type: map of strings key value pairs
set-request-headers.description: Sets static and dynamic values for given request headers. Available substitutions: ${pomerium.id_token}, ${pomerium.access_token}, ${pomerium.client_cert_fingerprint}.

show-error-details.title: Show Error Details
show-error-details.description: If applied, shows error details, including policy explanation and remediation for 403 Forbidden responses.

tls-client-certificate.title: TLS Client Certificate
tls-client-certificate.description: Pomerium presents this client certificate to upstream services when requested to enforce mTLS.

tls-custom-certificate-authority.title: TLS Custom Certificate Authority
tls-custom-certificate-authority.description: Defines a set of root certificate authorities that Pomerium uses when verifying upstream server certificates.

tls-skip-verification.title: TLS Skip Verification
tls-skip-verification.description: If applied, Pomerium accepts any certificate presented by the upstream server and any Hostname in that certificate. Use for testing only.

tls-upstream-allow-renegotiation.title: TLS Upstream Allow Renegotiation
tls-upstream-allow-renegotiation.description: If applied, this setting allows server-initiated TLS renegotiation for upstream servers.

tls-upstream-server-name.title: TLS Upstream Server Name
tls-upstream-server-name.description: This server name overrides the Hostname in the 'To:' field, and will be used to verify the certificate name.

tls-downstream-server-name.title: TLS Downstream Server Name
tls-downstream-server-name.description: This server name overrides the Hostname in the 'From:' field, and serves as the Server Name Indication when establishing a TLS connection with Pomerium.

to.title: To
to.description: The destination(s) of a proxied request. Must contain a scheme and Hostname, with an optional weight.

spdy.title: SPDY
spdy.description: If applied, this setting enables Pomerium to proxy SPDY protocol upgrades.

websocket-connections.title: Websocket Connections
websocket-connections.description: If applied, this setting enables Pomerium to proxy websocket connections.

google-cloud-serverless-authentication-s.title: Google Cloud Serverless Authentication Service Account

signing-key.title: Signing Key
signing-key.description: Signing Key is the key used to sign a user's attestation JWT which can be consumed by upstream applications to pass along identifying user information like username, id, and groups.

signing-key-file.title: Signing Key File
signing-key-file.description: File path to a secret containing the signing key, used to sign a user's attestation JWT which can be consumed by upstream applications to pass along identifying user information like username, id, and groups.

devices.title: Devices
devices.description: Introduced in v0.16.0, the Manage Devices page lets administrators manage user devices for policy-based authorization.

migrate-routes.title: Migrate Routes
migrate-routes.description: A way to migrate routes from an existing Open Source Pomerium config file. You probably only want to do this once.

search-users.title: Search Users
search-users.description: New Enrollment URLs are only valid for the specified user.

redirect-url.title: Redirect URL
redirect-url.description: Optional: The URL the user will be taken to after device enrollment is successful.

enrollment-type.title: Enrollment Type
enrollment-type.description: Specify if the user can enroll any device identity, or restrict it to a secure enclave.

direct-response.title: Direct Response
direct-response.description: Instructs Pomerium to send a static HTTP response to the downstream client for a managed route.

response-status.title: Direct Response Status
response-status.description: Sets the status code that Pomerium returns for a static HTTP response. Type: Integer. For example, 200.

response-body.title: Direct Response Body
response-body.description: Specifies the response body that Pomerium returns for a static HTTP response. Type: String. For example, 'plain text.'

cluster-settings-name.title: Cluster Name
cluster-settings-name.description: A customizable name that identifies a cluster. Defaults to the cluster's randomly generated starter domain name.

cluster-starter-domain.title: Cluster Starter Domain
cluster-starter-domain.description: The randomly generated starter domain assigned to this cluster. This domain is not changeable, and is designed to be used as a proof of concept.

detected-ip-address.title: Detected IP Address
detected-ip-address.description: The IP address detected for this cluster server.

override-ip-address.title: Override IP Address
override-ip-address.description: Manually sets the IP address of this cluster and overrides the detected IP. Use this setting if Pomerium can't connect to cluster over detected IP.

cluster-identity.title: Cluster Identity
cluster-identity.description: The cluster token that associates this cluster with a personal account or organization.

custom-domains.title: Custom Domains
custom-domains.description: A custom wildcard subdomain used to define routes in this cluster. Can only be associated with 1 cluster.
